trans-unit.source: On-Premises Oracle Linked Service
trans-unit.target: On-Premises Oracle Linked Service

trans-unit.source: This topic provides the JSON format that is supported by the older versions of Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: This topic provides the JSON format that is supported by the older versions of Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: If you are using the July 2015 Release version of Azure PowerShell or later, see <link xlink:href="06ea2928-7b43-4358-b508-5774ace47120" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">On-Premises Oracle Linked Service</link> for the latest JSON format.
trans-unit.target: If you are using the July 2015 Release version of Azure PowerShell or later, see <link xlink:href="06ea2928-7b43-4358-b508-5774ace47120" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">On-Premises Oracle Linked Service</link> for the latest JSON format.

trans-unit.source: You can convert the JSON from old format to new format by using the tool: <externalLink><linkText>JSON Upgrade Tool</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=618507</linkUri></externalLink>
trans-unit.target: You can convert the JSON from old format to new format by using the tool: <externalLink><linkText>JSON Upgrade Tool</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=618507</linkUri></externalLink>

trans-unit.source: You create an On-premises Oracle linked service to link an on-premises Oracle database to an Azure data factory.
trans-unit.target: You create an On-premises Oracle linked service to link an on-premises Oracle database to an Azure data factory.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes syntax for defining an on-premises Oracle linked service in a JSON file.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes syntax for defining an on-premises Oracle linked service in a JSON file.

trans-unit.source: When you use the Data Factory Editor in Azure Portal, the editor provides you a JSON template for defining a linked service that you can modify and deploy to create a linked service.
trans-unit.target: When you use the Data Factory Editor in Azure Portal, the editor provides you a JSON template for defining a linked service that you can modify and deploy to create a linked service.

trans-unit.source: To use the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.Azure.Commands.DataFactories.New-AzureDataFactoryLinkedService</codeEntityReference> cmdlet to create a linked service, you will need to create a JSON file and use it with the cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: To use the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.Azure.Commands.DataFactories.New-AzureDataFactoryLinkedService</codeEntityReference> cmdlet to create a linked service, you will need to create a JSON file and use it with the cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: For the Azure Data Factory service to be able to connect to your on-premises Oracle database, you must install the following:
trans-unit.target: For the Azure Data Factory service to be able to connect to your on-premises Oracle database, you must install the following:

trans-unit.source: Data Management Gateway on the on-premises computer either on the same machine that hosts the database or on a separate machine to avoid competing for resources with the database.
trans-unit.target: Data Management Gateway on the on-premises computer either on the same machine that hosts the database or on a separate machine to avoid competing for resources with the database.

trans-unit.source: Data Management Gateway is a software that connects on-premises data sources to cloud services in a secure and managed way.See <externalLink><linkText>Enable your pipelines to work with on-premises data</linkText><linkUri>https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/data-factory-use-onpremises-datasources/</linkUri></externalLink> for detail about Data Management Gateway.
trans-unit.target: Data Management Gateway is a software that connects on-premises data sources to cloud services in a secure and managed way.See <externalLink><linkText>Enable your pipelines to work with on-premises data</linkText><linkUri>https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/data-factory-use-onpremises-datasources/</linkUri></externalLink> for detail about Data Management Gateway.

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>Oracle Data Access Components (ODAC) for Windows</linkText><linkUri>http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/topics/dotnet/utilsoft-086879.html</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>Oracle Data Access Components (ODAC) for Windows</linkText><linkUri>http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/topics/dotnet/utilsoft-086879.html</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: It must be installed on the host machine where the gateway is installed.
trans-unit.target: It must be installed on the host machine where the gateway is installed.

trans-unit.source: When creating a dataset based on this linked service, you set the location type in the dataset JSON to: <link xlink:href="5606aefb-b5d3-49f0-b108-2ab3d0652e77#Oracle" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">OnPremisesOracleTableLocation</link>.
trans-unit.target: When creating a dataset based on this linked service, you set the location type in the dataset JSON to: <link xlink:href="5606aefb-b5d3-49f0-b108-2ab3d0652e77#Oracle" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">OnPremisesOracleTableLocation</link>.

trans-unit.source: When creating a pipeline, you set the source type to <link xlink:href="5606aefb-b5d3-49f0-b108-2ab3d0652e77#Oracle" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">OracleSource</link> if you are using an on-premises Oracle database as a source in a copy operation.
trans-unit.target: When creating a pipeline, you set the source type to <link xlink:href="5606aefb-b5d3-49f0-b108-2ab3d0652e77#Oracle" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">OracleSource</link> if you are using an on-premises Oracle database as a source in a copy operation.

trans-unit.source: Using an Oracle database as a sink in a copy operation is not supported yet.
trans-unit.target: Using an Oracle database as a sink in a copy operation is not supported yet.

trans-unit.source: Properties
trans-unit.target: Properties

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: type
trans-unit.target: type

trans-unit.source: The type property should be set to: <embeddedLabel>OnPremisesOracleLinkedService</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The type property should be set to: <embeddedLabel>OnPremisesOracleLinkedService</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: connectionString
trans-unit.target: connectionString

trans-unit.source: Specify connection string information needed to connect to the on-premises Oracle database using basic authentication.
trans-unit.target: Specify connection string information needed to connect to the on-premises Oracle database using basic authentication.

trans-unit.source: The connection string must be in the <externalLink><linkText>Oracle Connect Descriptor</linkText><linkUri>https://docs.oracle.com/cd/B28359_01/win.111/b28375/featConnecting.htm</linkUri></externalLink> format.
trans-unit.target: The connection string must be in the <externalLink><linkText>Oracle Connect Descriptor</linkText><linkUri>https://docs.oracle.com/cd/B28359_01/win.111/b28375/featConnecting.htm</linkUri></externalLink> format.

trans-unit.source: gatewayName
trans-unit.target: gatewayName

trans-unit.source: Name of the gateway that the Data Factory service should use to connect to the on-premises Oracle database.
trans-unit.target: Name of the gateway that the Data Factory service should use to connect to the on-premises Oracle database.

trans-unit.target: Example
